definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very

sentences.english: The more things a man is ashamed of the more respectable he is.
sentences.chinese: 一个人引以为耻的事情越多，就越可敬。

sentences.english: Nobody expected a respectable 65 year-old man to be a killer.
sentences.chinese: 谁能料到一个可敬的65岁老人会是杀人凶手。

sentences.english: Roderigo. Ay, and said nothing but what I protest intendment of doing.
sentences.chinese: 罗德利哥最可敬的老先生，您听得出我的声音吗？

sentences.english: He wore an air of serenity which rendered him singularly venerable.
sentences.chinese: 他神态安详，使他显得异样地庄严可敬。

sentences.english: The respectability of youth lies in their courage and great expectations.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人的可敬之处在于勇气和远大前程。

sentences.english: An admirable people wrests a living from the reluctant soil and the merciless seas.
sentences.chinese: 可敬可佩的人们从贫瘠的土地和严酷的大海谋求生计。

sentences.english: Most reverend signior , do you know my voice ?
sentences.chinese: 最可敬的老先生，您听得出我的声音吗？

sentences.english: The respected Gungan dressed in the formal clothes of a Rep, complete with hood and robes.
sentences.chinese: 这位可敬的冈根人身着配有长袍和兜帽的议事正装。

sentences.english: Roderigo. Most reverend signior, do you know my voice?
sentences.chinese: 罗德利哥最可敬的老先生，您听得出我的声音吗？

sentences.english: He is a boy and a soldier, beautiful and fierce, honorable and angry.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个男孩，一名战士，俊美而凶狠，可敬却气愤。

sentences.english: It just so happened that this honorable gentle teacher was the reborn Enlightenment Being.
sentences.chinese: 突然之间那位高尚而可敬的老师就象是圣人再世一样。

sentences.english: His uncle was as base and unworthy as his father had been upright and honourable.
sentences.chinese: 他的叔叔卑鄙龌龊，不像他父亲那样正直可敬。

sentences.english: He 1s a respectable teacher. so we are all respectful to him.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位可敬的老师，因此我们都尊敬他。

sentences.english: Two large rooms on the third floor were prepared for desirable tenants.
sentences.chinese: 四楼的两间大屋收拾干净等待可敬的房客。

sentences.english: I think him every thing that is worthy and amiable.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得他可敬可亲极了。

definition: to feel deep veneration for sb (idiom)
to abandon self for others (idiom, from Analects); to sacrifice one's own interest for other people/altruism
